content:
Wi-Fi connectivity will provide you with a more reliable and convenient experience, especially in a larger living room. With Wi-Fi, you'll be able to control your smart bulbs from anywhere in the room, and even from other rooms in your home, as long as you have a stable internet connection.

Since you already have a reliable Wi-Fi network set up, it's a great choice to leverage that infrastructure for your smart bulbs. You'll be able to control your bulbs using your smartphone or tablet, and you'll have access to a wide range of features and functionalities, such as scheduling, automation, and voice control through smart speakers like Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant.

Just keep in mind that you'll need to ensure your Wi-Fi network is strong and stable to support the smart bulbs. You may need to adjust the placement of your router or add a Wi-Fi range extender to ensure a strong signal throughout your living room.

Now that you've decided on Wi-Fi connectivity, you can start exploring the different smart bulb brands and models that offer Wi-Fi connectivity. Some popular options include Philips Hue, LIFX, and Belkin Wemo. Be sure to research and compare the features, pricing, and customer reviews of each brand to find the best fit for your needs.
